thread.title: Aussie viral surfer sensation Sabre Norris on Ellen
thread.title_full: Aussie viral surfer sensation Sabre Norris on Ellen

author: Natalie Wolfe
title: Aussie viral surfer sensation Sabre Norris on Ellen
text:
THE hilarious and ridiculously energetic Sabre took the world by storm late last year when she gave an interview to rival all interviews — catching the eye of Ellen DeGeneres in the process. 
Twelve-year old surfer Sabre Norris then charmed the pants off the American talk show host in December in a chat that finished with Ellen sending her to the little surfer’s dream city, Las Vegas.
“My mum said I had no chance of getting on the Ellen Show , and I’m on the Ellen Show! ” Sabre exclaimed.
The surf pro’s first interview on Ellen which she couldn’t believe was happening. Source: YouTube 
In an interview with the Today Show , Norris revealed she headed to the City of Sin with a camera crew in tow who filmed her “just eating as much as I wanted at the buffets.”
And the pint-sized pro was back on Ellen today, when DeGeneres treated us to the footage. 
“When I’m your friend, everybody treats me like a princess,” Sabre told the talk show host.
She also offered Ellen some sound advice on the tactical way of approaching buffet restaurants.
“You’ve gotta eat more than what the price is, that’s how you win,” she told her. “So, if it’s $20, you’ve gotta eat $30.”
How to eat at buffets 101. Source: YouTube 
Ellen told the bubbly surfer their last interview had been watched more than three million times, to which Norris admitted she had to apologise for something.
“Well, you know how I said swimming sucked?” the 12-year asked. “I think that three million people watched me saying swimming sucked so I wanna retract that statement.”
Sabre’s father is Newcastle swimmer Justin Norris who won a bronze medal at the 2000 Sydney Olympics and now runs a swimming academy in the NSW city.
“My dad said that, because we own a swimming business, it probably wasn’t the best thing to say.”
‘Swimming’s great!’ Source: YouTube 
Now 12 years old, the surfer told Ellen she’s become a bit more responsible. “This was the first time in four years that I haven’t vomited on my birthday ... because my parents let me eat whatever I want, so I’m becoming more responsible,” she said.
The Aussie grom also went through her new year’s resolutions with Ellen.
While some were exactly what you’d expect from a 12-year-old, including “stop cheating in maths”, “don’t whinge about eating vegetables” and “help a granny across the road”, others were written with a little more cunning.
One resolution Ellen was able to deliver on was, “Sit in Ellen’s Porsche for five minutes”, which the host revealed “she was going to make come true.”
Scoring a ride in Ellen’s Porsche for five minutes. Source: YouTube 
The Aussie surfer became an internet sensation after giving a post-surf interview at Cronulla in November.
The pint-sized prodigy spoke with the Today Show after becoming the second youngest surfer ever to compete in a World Surf League event when she accepted Sally Fitzgibbon’s invitation to the Sydney International Pro.
And she smashed the interview.
Speaking to Karl Stefanovic, Sabre exclaimed: “I can’t believe Sally gave me the wildcard.
“I can’t believe out of all the girls in the world she’s chosen me. I feel really excited but I’m a little bit nervous. Sometimes it feels like I’m going to vomit.
Norris reportedly became the second youngest ever to compete in World Surf League event. Source: Supplied 
“Even if I get last (place) they’re going to do $250 prize money for last,” she said. “I really would want to spend it on doughnuts.”
Sabre ended up coming 25th out of 100 all aged surfers.
If you still can’t get enough of the pint-sized pro, never fear — in her newest interview with Ellen, the host revealed she was sending Sabre to be her red carpet correspondent at the Kids Choice Awards in March.
You can watch the full, incomparable interview below.
